title: OpenAI Raises $110 Billion Led by Amazon, Nvidia and SoftBank, Extending A.I. Boom
partialText: Amazon, Nvidia and SoftBank led the investment, valuing the parent of ChatGPT at $730 billion.

title: The I.R.S. Shut Its Direct File, but Here Are Other Free Filing Options
partialText: The agency still offers a Free File program that works with commercial tax software firms. Some companies also offer free tools for certain filers.

title: E.U. Pushes Ahead With South American Trade Deal Despite Legal Challenge
partialText: The provisional application of the agreement with Brazil, Argentina, Paraguay and Uruguay is intended to diversify Europe’s trading relationships.

title: Paramount Is Set to Win Warner Bros. Now Comes the Hard Part.
partialText: The media company controlled by the Ellisons out-dueled Netflix for control of Warner Bros. Discovery. The next step is making the combined media empires work.

title: How India Became One of the World’s Biggest Economies
partialText: India has grown rapidly despite its slow industrialization, and its economy is now nearly as big as Japan’s.

title: For CNN, a Takeover by Paramount Means a Suddenly Uncertain Future
partialText: Paramount’s apparent victory over Netflix in securing Warner Bros. Discovery has led to concerns within the CNN newsroom.

title: What Larry and David Ellison Would Own After Warner Bros. Takeover
partialText: If Paramount can close its deal to buy Warner Bros. Discovery, Larry and David Ellison will influence nearly every corner of news, entertainment and tech.

title: A World Where All Is Free? That’s Elon Musk’s Theory of ‘Sustainable Abundance.’
partialText: The Tesla and SpaceX chief has told his followers that they will live in a world where robots will take care of every need and people do not have to work, in what has become his latest slogan.

title: The Web of Companies Owned by Elon Musk
partialText: In mapping out Elon Musk’s wealth, our investigation found that Mr. Musk is behind more than 90 companies in Texas. Kirsten Grind, a New York Times Investigations reporter, explains what her team found.

title: The Rise and Fall of a 3-D Printing Empire
partialText: Desktop Metal, a billion-dollar start-up, promised to revolutionize manufacturing. It went bankrupt, and now has much humbler ambitions as the 3-D printing industry takes a sober turn.

title: Elon Musk’s Secret Web of Companies in Texas
partialText: The megabillionaire was tied to about 90 companies in the state, which he uses for everything from paying nannies to buying land to supporting Donald Trump’s re-election, according to a Times examination.

title: Honolulu on a Budget
partialText: Hawaii is expensive, but basing yourself in the capital, where local culture and nature are within easy reach, can save you money on lodgings and food, leaving funds for a few splurges.

title: South Korea Clears Way for Google Maps to Fully Operate
partialText: South Korea approved Google’s request to export detailed map data, reversing a longstanding restriction that made the tool largely nonfunctional.

title: With a New Nigeria Refinery, Africa’s Richest Man Wants ‘to Rescue the Country’
partialText: Aliko Dangote, Africa’s richest man, has an ambitious vision for the continent’s most populous nation, but hurdles stand in his way.

title: India Built the World’s Back Office. A.I. Is Starting to Shrink It.
partialText: Artificial intelligence promises to automate the white-collar work that made India a tech powerhouse. The country is racing to adapt before it’s too late.

title: Germany’s Oil and Gas Output Is Dwindling as Prices Rise
partialText: Natural gas production in Germany has fallen about 80 percent in the past two decades even as the country seeks to replace flows from Russia.

title: 32.6 Million Watched Trump’s State of the Union Address, Nielsen Says
partialText: The audience was roughly on par with former President Biden’s final State of the Union address in 2024.

title: Block Cuts 40% of Its Work Force Because of Its Embrace of A.I.
partialText: About 4,000 workers will lose their jobs as the payments company does more work with new artificial intelligence tools, its top executive said.

title: Netflix Backs Out of Bid for Warner Bros., Paving Way for Paramount Takeover
partialText: The move was a stunning development in the long-running corporate battle for the storied media giant.

title: Oliver Grant, a Business Architect of the Wu-Tang Clan, Dies
partialText: He was behind the scenes with Wu-Tang Clan, the New York rap group, since its founding and helped expand its reach with a fashion line.

title: FedEx Says It Could Return Tariff Refunds to Customers
partialText: The company sued the administration days after the Supreme Court ruled against the president’s duties.

title: U.S. Mortgage Rates Fall Below 6% for First Time in Years
partialText: The evidence is patchy on whether lower rates have meaningfully spurred more activity, as the Trump administration floats measures it says will make housing more affordable.

title: Why Estrogen Patches For Menopause Are So Hard to Find
partialText: Changing attitudes around menopause treatment have driven up demand for hormone therapy.

title: They Helped Women Fight Online Abuse. They Were Barred From the U.S.
partialText: The founders of HateAid, a German human-rights group that helps victims of online attacks, were accused by the Trump administration of being part of a “global censorship-industrial complex.”

title: How a Close Associate of Epstein’s Found Career Redemption in Japan
partialText: Top Japanese officials are backing a tech and entrepreneurship initiative led in part by Joichi Ito, whose involvement with Jeffrey Epstein may endanger efforts to get the project off the ground.

title: He Hopes to Turn the Island of Nevis Into a Libertarian Paradise, With Crypto
partialText: A Bitcoin baron wants to build a libertarian paradise on the island of Nevis. Democracy is getting in the way.

title: Why Nvidia’s Big Profits Aren’t Lifting Markets
partialText: The chip giant at the center of the artificial intelligence boom again beat expectations. But it didn’t overcome investor jitters.

title: Revel, a Maker of Software for Running Hardware, Raises $150 Million
partialText: The start-up, founded by a former top SpaceX engineer, promises to help companies reduce their testing times and optimize systems.

title: World Economic Forum Chief Resigns Over Epstein Ties
partialText: Borge Brende, a former foreign minister of Norway, had maintained contact with the convicted sex offender.

title: Z? Zo? Mam? Mayor Zohran Mamdani is a Man of Many Nicknames.
partialText: Mayor Zohran Mamdani has been given a bevy of nicknames by New York City’s tabloid newspapers and political class. Which will stick?

title: New A.C.A. Plans Could Increase Family Deductibles to $31,000
partialText: The Trump administration is proposing Obamacare plans that it says will lower health insurance premiums. But critics warn they would make care unaffordable.

title: A.I. Dating Apps Complicate China’s Efforts to Boost Birthrate
partialText: As China grapples with a shrinking population and historically low birthrate, people are finding romance with chatbots instead.

title: Kalshi Accuses a ‘MrBeast’ Employee of Insider Trading
partialText: The prediction-market platform said it had reported the employee to federal regulators. The show’s parent company said it had “no tolerance for this behavior.”

title: For America’s 250th, Should the Coin of Trump’s Realm Be Gold?
partialText: A federally appointed committee is pushing back on plans to mint gold currency depicting President Trump.

title: Trump Proposed a New Retirement Plan for With Up to a $1,000 Match. What to Know.
partialText: An existing law could help create new retirement savings plans for people who lack them. But there may be income restrictions on any match.

title: Businesses Push for Tariff Refunds as Trump Aides Hint at Fight to Come
partialText: By the president’s own admission, it could be years before the matter is settled, even though the administration previously indicated it would pay.

title: Blaming Tariffs, Aston Martin Will Trim 20% of Its Work Force
partialText: The luxury automaker said losses for 2025 had increased from the year before, as tariffs and geopolitical uncertainty took a toll on its operations.

title: What Trump Did (and Didn’t) Say in the State of the Union Speech
partialText: The president boasted about a strong economy in his State of the Union address. But he spent less time on a potential weakness, affordability.

title: Bleak Research Report Stokes A.I. Debate on Wall St.
partialText: In a widely circulated note, Citrini Research painted a dire picture of job losses and stock market sell-offs, though many analysts and economists questioned its conclusions.

title: From the French Riviera to Kyoto, Japan, 5 New Luxury Hotels
partialText: From palatial to contemporary to luxuriously rustic, this collection of new resorts and inns offers spas, private gardens, fine restaurants and exquisite settings.

title: Abu Dhabi’s State Oil Company Looks Beyond Oil
partialText: Having reshaped the company, Sultan Ahmed Al Jaber wants to expand internationally, particularly in natural gas, chemicals and renewables.

title: Court Rules Against Justice Dept. Search of Reporter’s Computers
partialText: The judge said the court itself would search the devices, which were seized from a Washington Post reporter’s home last month.

title: Wayve, an A.I. Driverless Car Start-Up in Europe, Raises $1.2 Billion
partialText: The London-based company is building a system that uses artificial intelligence to power autonomous vehicles.

title: Pentagon Gives Anthropic an Ultimatum Over the Company’s A.I. Model
partialText: Anthropic insists on limits on how its technology is used and could be labeled a supply chain risk if it fails to accept the military’s demands.

title: Paramount Raises Its Bid for Warner Bros. Discovery
partialText: Warner Bros. Discovery said Paramount’s new offer of $31 a share could lead to a “superior proposal” to the deal it signed with Netflix.

title: Senator Blumenthal Opens Inquiry Into Iran Transactions on Binance
partialText: Senator Richard Blumenthal of Connecticut sent a letter to Binance asking about the flow of $1.7 billion from accounts on the crypto exchange to Iranian entities.

title: House Narrowly Rejects Air Safety Bill After Pentagon Opposition
partialText: A move to swiftly pass the bill failed by a single vote. It would have required aircraft to carry technology that officials said might have prevented a midair collision near Washington last year.

title: Averted Midair Collision Shows Importance of Air Safety Act, Backers Say
partialText: The legislation’s advocates say a close call between two private planes near Teterboro, N.J., on Feb. 13 underscored how collision prevention technology could save lives.

title: Home Depot Says Homeowners Are Weary From Economic Pressures
partialText: The retailer said same-store sales were nearly flat as homeowners shied away from big-ticket projects amid worries about housing costs and the job market.
